title: How to Make a Detailed LEGO House, Garage, and Car

steps.headline: Get bases like two 15x15 pieces.
steps.description: On one of the 15x15 bases, leave a 2x15 space on the edges and a 1x15 space at the ends.

steps.headline: Start building.
steps.description: Make sure everything is parallel with the other side. Leave a space for the door. About two layers up, put in windows and three layers up take a car cover and put it in a space, recommended around the edge. Put bricks on the bottom, and put studs on it. This will be your "food".

steps.headline: Around 4 layers, get a brick with a hole in it which is small enough to fit a hook.
steps.description: Then take a 4x4, a yellow clear piece, and a stud to make a lantern.

steps.headline: Continue making layers.
steps.description: You can make a roof by putting roof pieces on on each side, or you can leave it with no roof if you want to play with it.

steps.headline: Get a roof piece and a smooth 4x4 piece.
steps.description: Put the roof piece on the end and the smooth piece facing in the direction it's ending. Then, take bricks to make a wall in the middle of the house, but leave a 3x3 space after it.

steps.headline: Make a stove by placing a 4x4 round piece and red studs around it.
steps.description: Take a pot and mug and put studs in them.

steps.headline: Make a toilet by taking a 4x4 piece and taking four 2x1 pieces.
steps.description: Stack them together in groups of four. Then, take a seat and put it at the end. Take the 2x1 bricks on the sides of the 4x4. Then take a 2x1 and a 1x1 and put it on the edge.

steps.headline: Make a pool by taking flat blue pieces.
steps.description: Take vent pieces too. Arrange the blue pieces in a square or rectangle and put vent pieces all around.

steps.headline: Make a diving board by taking 1x1 and putting a 4x1 on top of them.
steps.description: You can do this as many times as you want.

steps.headline: To make the car, take wheels, a seat and steering wheel, and 8x4 pieces.
steps.description: Take a 4x4 and put the wheels on. Then, take a steering wheel and seat.

steps.headline: Make the garage by taking 9x6 bases and putting roof pieces stacked on the edges.
steps.description: Then, take flat pieces to make a roof.

text: Making the House Get bases like two 15x15 pieces. On one of the 15x15 bases, leave a 2x15 space on the edges and a 1x15 space at the ends. Start building. Make sure everything is parallel with the other side. Leave a space for the door. About two layers up, put in windows and three layers up take a car cover and put it in a space, recommended around the edge. Put bricks on the bottom, and put studs on it. This will be your "food". Around 4 layers, get a brick with a hole in it which is small enough to fit a hook. Then take a 4x4, a yellow clear piece, and a stud to make a lantern. Continue making layers. You can make a roof by putting roof pieces on on each side, or you can leave it with no roof if you want to play with it. Adding Details Get a roof piece and a smooth 4x4 piece. Put the roof piece on the end and the smooth piece facing in the direction it's ending. Then, take bricks to make a wall in the middle of the house, but leave a 3x3 space after it. Make a stove by placing a 4x4 round piece and red studs around it. Take a pot and mug and put studs in them. Make a toilet by taking a 4x4 piece and taking four 2x1 pieces. Stack them together in groups of four. Then, take a seat and put it at the end. Take the 2x1 bricks on the sides of the 4x4. Then take a 2x1 and a 1x1 and put it on the edge. Making a Pool Make a pool by taking flat blue pieces. Take vent pieces too. Arrange the blue pieces in a square or rectangle and put vent pieces all around. Make a diving board by taking 1x1 and putting a 4x1 on top of them. You can do this as many times as you want. Adding a Car and Garage To make the car, take wheels, a seat and steering wheel, and 8x4 pieces. Take a 4x4 and put the wheels on. Then, take a steering wheel and seat. Make the garage by taking 9x6 bases and putting roof pieces stacked on the edges. Then, take flat pieces to make a roof.
